extendedIngredients.name: vanilla cream filled sandwich style cookies

recipes.title: Sunflower Potluck Cake

winePairing.pairingText: Cream Sherry, Moscato d'Asti, and Port are great choices for Cake. A common wine pairing rule is to make sure your wine is sweeter than your food. Delicate desserts go well with Moscato d'Asti, nutty desserts with cream sherry, and caramel or chocolate desserts pair well with port. You could try NV Solera Cream Sherry. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.5 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 17 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: NV Solera Cream Sherry
productMatches.description: The Solera Cream Sherry has a brilliant amber and deep copper hue. With butterscotch and pecan aromas, the sweet salted nut and brown spice aromas carry a complex caramel accent. A sweet entry leads to a rounded, lush, moderately full-bodied palate with a lengthy, flavorful finish.

recipes.instructions: Directions                                                                                In a large bowl, cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Beat in vanilla. Combine dry ingredients; gradually add to the creamed mixture alternately with water, beating well after each addition. Pour into two greased and floured 9-in. round baking pans.                                                                                            Bake at 350° for 25-30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean. Cool in pans for 10 minutes before removing to wire racks to cool completely.                                                                                            Freeze one layer for future use. Set aside 1 tablespoon frosting. Frost top and sides of remaining cake.                                                                                            Place cake in the center of a large round tray (about 18 in.) Arrange chocolate chips on top of cake. Place sponge cakes around cake. Mix reserved frosting with milk; drizzle over sponge cakes. Decorate with bees if desired.                                        Yield: 22 servings.                                                                                                                         Originally published as Sunflower Potluck Cake in  Country WomanMay/June 1996, p31                                                                                                                                                                                                        Nutritional Facts                                                                             1 serving (1 each) equals 415 calories, 17 g fat (7 g saturated fat), 53 mg cholesterol, 441 mg sodium, 65 g carbohydrate, 1 g fiber, 4 g protein.                                                                                                                                                                     Print                                                                                    Add to Recipe Box                            Email a Friend

steps.step: In a large bowl, cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Beat in vanilla.
Combine dry ingredients; gradually add to the creamed mixture alternately with water, beating well after each addition.
Pour into two greased and floured 9-in. round baking pans.
Bake at 350° for 25-30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean. Cool in pans for 10 minutes before removing to wire racks to cool completely.
Freeze one layer for future use. Set aside 1 tablespoon frosting. Frost top and sides of remaining cake.
Place cake in the center of a large round tray (about 18 in.) Arrange chocolate chips on top of cake.
Mix reserved frosting with milk; drizzle over sponge cakes. Decorate with bees if desired.
